required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on April 10, 2017
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: PF-06741086 Multiple Dose Study in Severe Hemophilia
clinical_study.official_title: A Multicenter, Open-label, Multiple Ascending Dose Study To Evaluate The Safety, Tolerability, Pharmacokinetics, Pharmacodynamics, And Efficacy Of Subcutaneous And/or Intravenous Pf-06741086 In Subjects With Severe Hemophilia

brief_summary.textblock: This study is designed to evaluate the safety, tolerability, pharmacokinetics, pharmacodynamics and efficacy of multiple subcutaneous and/or intravenous doses of PF-06741086 in subjects with severe hemophilia.

primary_outcome.measure: Frequency, severity and causal relationship of treatment emergent adverse events (TEAEs) and withdrawals due to TEAEs
primary_outcome.description: Treatment-related AE was any untoward medical occurrence attributed to study drug in a participant who received study drug. Serious adverse event (SAE) was an AE resulting in any of the following outcomes or deemed significant for any other reason: death; initial or prolonged inpatient hospitalization; life-threatening experience (immediate risk of dying); persistent or significant disability/incapacity; congenital anomaly.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of subjects with laboratory abnormalities
primary_outcome.description: Following parameters were analyzed for laboratory examination: hematology, serum chemistry, and urinalysis.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of subjects with changes from baseline in vital signs
primary_outcome.description: Following parameters were analyzed for vital sign examination: blood pressure, pulse rate, temperature, respiration rate.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of subjects with change from baseline in electrocardiogram (ECG) parameters
primary_outcome.description: Following parameters were analyzed for ECG examinations: QT interval (QTc), QTcF interval (Fridericia's Correction), QRS complex, PR interval, and RR interval.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of subjects with changes from baseline in physical examination
primary_outcome.description: Following parameters were analyzed for full physical examinations: head, ears, eyes, nose, mouth, skin, heart and lung examinations, lymph nodes, gastrointestinal, musculoskeletal, and neurological systems.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of subjects with infusion site reactions
primary_outcome.description: Following parameters were analyzed for injection site reaction examinations: induration, erythema, edema, rash, pruritis.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of subjects with injection site reactions
primary_outcome.description: Following parameters were analyzed for injection site reaction examinations: induration, erythema, edema, rash, pruritis.

secondary_outcome.description: Bleeding episodes requiring treatment with factor replacement.
An ex vivo pharmacodynamic measure of thrombin generation (initiation of thrombin generation).
An ex vivo pharmacodynamic measure of thrombin generation (maximum thrombin generation).
An ex vivo pharmacodynamic measure of thrombin generation (area under the thrombin generation curve).
An in vivo pharmacodynamic measure of thrombin generation (prothrombin cleavage).
An in vivo pharmacodynamic measure of thrombin generation (fibrin degradation).
An ex vivo pharmacodynamic measure of thrombin generation (via extrinsic pathway).
Total amount of tissue factor pathway inhibitor (bound and unbound) in plasma.

secondary_outcome.measure: Frequency of anti drug antibody (ADA) and neutralizing antibody (NAb) production against PF 06741086
secondary_outcome.description: The percentage of participants with positive ADA and neutralizing antibodies will be summarized for each treatment arm.
Plasma PF-06741086 concentrations over time
Maximum observed plasma concentration
Time to reach Cmax

secondary_outcome.measure: Area under the curve from time zero to last quantifiable concentration (AUClast)
secondary_outcome.description: Area under the curve from time zero to last quantifiable concentration
Plasma decay half-life is the time measured for the plasma concentration to decrease by one half.
Minimum observed plasma concentration

secondary_outcome.measure: Volume of distribution at steady state (Vss)
secondary_outcome.description: Volume of distribution is defined as the theoretical volume in which the total amount of drug would need to be uniformly distributed to produce the desired blood concentration of a drug. Steady state volume of distribution is the apparent volume of distribution at steady-state. IV administration only.
Clearance is a quantitative measure of the rate at which a drug substance is removed from the body. IV administration only.
Apparent clearance is a quantitative measure of the rate at which a drug substance is removed from the body.SC administration only.
Plasma concentrations at steady state
Time to reach steady state plasma concentrations

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Severe hemophilia A or B (Factor VIII or Factor IX activity â‰¤ 1%) with no known Factor VIII or Factor IX inhibitors
- Episodic (on-demand) treatment regimen prior to screening
- At least 6 acute bleeding episodes during the 6-month period prior to screening
Exclusion Criteria:
- Known coronary artery, thrombotic, or ischemic disease
- Detectable or documented history of inhibitors against Factor VIII or Factor IX during the 12-month period prior to screening
- Concomitant treatment with rFVIIa or activated prothrombin complex concentrate

facility.name: Hospital Universitario La Paz. Servicio de Farmacia - Drug Shipment Only
